content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is the requested function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```

This function uses the `filter` function to only keep those words that satisfy a condition. The condition checks if the first character of each word is the same as its capitalized version. This effectively filters out any word which does not start with a capital letter. 

You can use this function like so:

```julia
words = ["Dog", "cat", "bird", "Elephant"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println(filtered_words) # prints: ["Dog", "Elephant"]
```
